definition: earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
muddled and completely collapsing (idiom); in an awful condition/complete shambles/a total mess
talus slide/to crumble (of scree slope)/to collapse/landslide
variant of 踏實|踏实[ta1 shi5]
to be hell-bent on/dead set on sth/unswerving
rosette bok choy (Brassica rapa var. rosularis)
to collapse (of building, dam or bridge)

sentences.english: I rised my head and saw the ceiling was dropping, felt the classroom was sinking.
sentences.chinese: 我擡頭，看見房頂往下塌，感覺教室在不停地下沉。

sentences.english: When a large mass is there, such as a star, it will be collapsed.
sentences.chinese: 但當一個質量大嘅星球放上去，就會塌左落去。

sentences.english: Be careful, the roof might cave in and we'll fall through!
sentences.chinese: 小心點，屋頂可能要塌，我們會掉下去的。

sentences.english: That sort of defeats are only stepping-stones.
sentences.chinese: 那種失敗只不過是前進的塌腳石。

sentences.english: Lanlan's nose is prominent, mine is much flatter.
sentences.chinese: 蘭蘭的鼻子挺，我的塌多了。

sentences.english: Well, that brought the house down.
sentences.chinese: 哎，那使整幢房子都要塌了。

sentences.english: People sometimes drag through life because of a chronic sleep deficit.
sentences.chinese: 人們有時因長期睡眠不足而疲疲塌塌地度過一生。

sentences.english: The stumbling blocks are just stepping stones to success.
sentences.chinese: 絆倒你的石頭正是成功路上的塌腳石。

sentences.english: The dam gave away. It was not strong enough to hold the flood waters.
sentences.chinese: 水壩塌了，它不夠堅固，擋不住洪水。

sentences.english: My wife put one pot on the rack and everything came crashing down.
sentences.chinese: 太太拿了只鍋放上去，燈就塌了。

sentences.english: Twenty years is a long time, but not long enough to change a man's nose from a Roman nose to a pug nose.
sentences.chinese: 二十年時間是很長，但不至於把鷹釣鼻變成塌鼻樑。

sentences.english: The roof of the ancient temple caved in because of bad maintenance.
sentences.chinese: 那座古剎由於維護不好屋頂塌了下來。

sentences.english: The small chair yielded under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 那把小椅子喫不住他的重量，塌了。

sentences.english: " The sky is falling, " says Bear.
Someone shouted. “The foundation is falling apart.”
The roof of that ancient temple caved in because of bad maintenance.
sentences.chinese: 由於年久失修那個古廟的屋頂塌了。

definition: muddled and completely collapsing (idiom); in an awful condition/complete shambles/a total mess
(onom.) rustling sound/sound of rain or of sth falling down/in disorder/completely smashed/badly battered/broken to pieces
shapeless/deformed/ruined/beyond recognition/(of a person) reduced to a shadow
to collapse/to break or wear down/to defeat
to pile up/to heap up/a mass/pile/heap/stack/large amount
same as 稀爛|稀烂[xi1 lan4]
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to defame/to slander
